poem:
**Industrial Morning**

so much depends  
upon  

a borrowed face  
on a screen  

glazed with easy light  
beside the coffee  

a president selling  
skin cream  
a premier pitching  
profit  

and the clerk, alone,  
wires the half-million  
to a voice  
that fits  

the day goes on  
unverified.
